content:
• Thursday, July 7, 2011
  • XXIA

    More on Ixia (NASDAQ:XXIA): Shares resumed trading, -14.3% after being halted earlier in the...

    More on Ixia (NASDAQ:XXIA): Shares resumed trading, -14.3% after being halted earlier in the extended session.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM
  • LEDS

    SemiLEDs (NASDAQ:LEDS) FQ3 EPS of ($0.16) misses by $0.10. Revenue of $5.6M (-43% Y/Y) misses by...

    SemiLEDs (NASDAQ:LEDS) FQ3 EPS of ($0.16) misses by $0.10. Revenue of $5.6M (-43% Y/Y) misses by $0.7M. FQ4 revenue guidance of $5.5-$6.5M below consensus of $9M. FQ4 EPS guidance of ($0.23-$0.25) below consensus of ($0.02). Shares -14.5% AH. Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) -1.8% AH in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • KLAC

    KLA-Tencor (KLAC +7%) continues to climb on a UBS upgrade ahead of the company's analyst day...

    KLA-Tencor (KLAC +7%) continues to climb on a UBS upgrade ahead of the company's analyst day tomorrow. The firm says the company's balance sheet is flush with cash, foundry orders are bottoming, and cash flows remain strong.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • JPM

    A New York appeals court has dismissed a RICO lawsuit accusing JPMorgan Chase (JPM +2.2%) of...

    A New York appeals court has dismissed a RICO lawsuit accusing JPMorgan Chase (JPM +2.2%) of conspiring in Bernie Madoff's Ponzi scheme - which could deal a blow to victims' trustee Irving Picard, who has fought to keep cases involving $100B in claims alive in bankruptcy court. Picard recently filed an amended $19.9B suit against JPM.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.9%) says it added more than 1M subscribers in Europe, Africa and the...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.9%) says it added more than 1M subscribers in Europe, Africa and the Middle East in three weeks, though shares likely are popping more from a short squeeze. Meanwhile, its decision to study the overhaul of its management structure to avoid a shareholder vote indicates it’s avoiding a commitment to appoint an independent chair, a proxy adviser firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • VIVO

    Meridian Bioscience (VIVO +3.6%) gains on a Lazard upgrade. The firm cites improved FY12 sales...

    Meridian Bioscience (VIVO +3.6%) gains on a Lazard upgrade. The firm cites improved FY12 sales visibility on its test menu for illumigene C. difficile - an infection that causes diarrhea - plus an expansion of the menu to include tests for Group B strep.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • CATO

    Though many retailers are moving higher after announcing their June sales data, Cato Corp. (CATO...

    Though many retailers are moving higher after announcing their June sales data, Cato Corp. (CATO -8.9%) definitely isn't one of them. While Cato's same-store sales growth of 1% slightly beat expectations, the company also announced FQ2 EPS will be in the range of $0.57-$0.59, compared with a consensus estimate of $0.59.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • WCG

    WellCare (WCG +3.2%) gains after being selected by Kentucky as a provider to the state's...

    WellCare (WCG +3.2%) gains after being selected by Kentucky as a provider to the state's Medicaid program in seven of its eight regions. The company says the new relationship will significantly contribute to its future revenue growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • NOC

    Northrop Grumman (NOC -2.4%) dips after Bernstein cuts shares to Market Perform on valuation,...

    Northrop Grumman (NOC -2.4%) dips after Bernstein cuts shares to Market Perform on valuation, seeing little further upside with coming federal budget cuts and a relatively flat revenue outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • CALI

    Chinese online auto dealer China Auto Logistics (OTC:CALI +79.3%) nearly doubles in active...

    Chinese online auto dealer China Auto Logistics (OTC:CALI +79.3%) nearly doubles in active trading following a $5.25M secondary placement at +38% above market price. "Our shares are significantly undervalued," CEO Tong Shiping says, "mainly because of the prevailing negativity temporarily affecting all Chinese company shares in the U.S."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • JASO

    Solar stocks are weak after Jefferies lowers its outlook for the sector due to increasing wafer...

    Solar stocks are weak after Jefferies lowers its outlook for the sector due to increasing wafer costs and a weak pricing environment for solar panels. The firm downgrades JA Solar (JASO -4.4%), Hanwha SolarOne (HSOL -4%), Canadian Solar (CSIQ -3.3%) MEMC Electronic Materials (WFR +0.5%), and SatCon (SATC +0.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    After lagging for months, tech bellwethers Apple (AAPL +1.6%) and Google (GOOG +1.9%) have...

    After lagging for months, tech bellwethers Apple (AAPL +1.6%) and Google (GOOG +1.9%) have outgained the broader market during the market run-up, indicating that the tech sector could be moving into a leadership role. Dave Kansas sees their rebound as anticipating a round of strong earnings and that the economy’s slow patch is "just a patch."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • BORN

    Edible alcohol maker China New Borun (BORN +13.5%) is adding to yesterday's gains on news of the...

    Edible alcohol maker China New Borun (BORN +13.5%) is adding to yesterday's gains on news of the company's plans to make adjustments to its auditing team. China New Borun, which had 16% of its float shorted as of June 15, previously had its finances called into question by Citron Research.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • LAS

    Chinese auto dealer Lentuo International (LAS -8.3%) dips following the announcement that its...

    Chinese auto dealer Lentuo International (LAS -8.3%) dips following the announcement that its CFO, Ping Yu, has resigned for personal reasons. The stock has been a poster child for disastrous Chinese IPOs, -55% since going public in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • SWKS

    A day after receiving two upgrades, Skyworks (SWKS +7%) gets a boost from UBS, which claims...

    A day after receiving two upgrades, Skyworks (SWKS +7%) gets a boost from UBS, which claims Skyworks will soon fix "a major competitive gap" in its power amplifier duplexer lineup relative to TriQuint (TQNT) and Avago (NASDAQ:AVGO), by offering chips with bulk acoustic wave filter capabilities. UBS has a buy rating and $40 PT on Skyworks.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • P

    Shares of Pandora (P +3.4%) move higher, even as the firm faces a new threat from a rumored...

    Shares of Pandora (P +3.4%) move higher, even as the firm faces a new threat from a rumored Facebook-Spotify partnership. Euro-centric Spotify does not now compete directly with Pandora's operation over subscribers, but the firm appears to have the U.S. market on its radar.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • LVS

    Shares of select casino stocks push higher, at least partially due to growing gaming prospects...

    Shares of select casino stocks push higher, at least partially due to growing gaming prospects in Macau. Brean Murray appears bullish on the sector, assigning a Buy rating on Las Vegas Sands (LVS +2.9%) with a $53 price target, and likes Wynn (WYNN +2.4%) as a Buy with a $175 target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • COF

    Capital One (COF +2.4%) moves up after KBW issues an upgrade on the shares and a price target...

    Capital One (COF +2.4%) moves up after KBW issues an upgrade on the shares and a price target hike. Though "lukewarm" on the ING Direct acquisition, KBW says the addition of "7M young, solid income generating, and loyal customers with $80B of low cost and stable deposits" could be "the starting point of gradually building a focused broader branch footprint."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • TVIAQ

    Shares of Solazyme (SZYM +0.8%) trade higher a day after Goldman initiates as a Buy with a $31...

    Shares of Solazyme (SZYM +0.8%) trade higher a day after Goldman initiates as a Buy with a $31 price target. The firm's cutting-edge algae-based oil is drawing notice from an airline industry looking at biofuels after commercial airlines received the go-ahead from regulators to use organic fuel mixes.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • CVX

    Energy stocks (XLE +1.2%) are among the morning's top gainers, as oil futures jump past $98...

    Energy stocks (XLE +1.2%) are among the morning's top gainers, as oil futures jump past $98 after the upbeat employment report from ADP. At least one oil analyst stays bullish: "There's just a general sense of optimism in the market." Gainers: CVX +2.2%, APA +1.9%, CNX +2.8%, XOM +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • BABY

    Natus Medical (BABY -8.5%) sinks as its Q2 revenue falls short due to several large orders the...

    Natus Medical (BABY -8.5%) sinks as its Q2 revenue falls short due to several large orders the company expected in late April failing to arrive. The firm expects to post revenue of ~$58M, well below its initial $62M to $64M forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • JPM

    Quite a boo-boo: The NY Post issues a correction to its story yesterday about a mortgage...

    Quite a boo-boo: The NY Post issues a correction to its story yesterday about a mortgage settlement with federal regulators and state AGS that could cost banks $60B; it now says the correct figure is more like $25B. Bank stocks (XLF +1.3%) rally: JPM +2.3%, WFC +2%, BAC +1.4%, C +1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 2 Comments
  • OCZ

    Enterprise solid-state drive vendor OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) is up 12.7% after reporting FQ1...

    Enterprise solid-state drive vendor OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) is up 12.7% after reporting FQ1 results that beat estimates, and delivering revenue guidance roughly in-line with forecasts. Fusion-IO (NYSE:FIO), which makes flash memory subsystems for servers, is up 1.3% in sympathy. (PR) (CC transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) gets a lift from Morgan Stanley with an upgrade to Overweight,...

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) gets a lift from Morgan Stanley with an upgrade to Overweight, and could extend yesterday's rally on expected strong sales. Shares +3.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) and Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) move higher premarket after...

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) and Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) move higher premarket after JPMorgan raises its ratings and price targets on the hard-drive makers. Both firms should benefit from favorable pricing conditions and bottoming unit trend-lines, pushing margins to "200 basis point or greater improvements" in the next 12-18 months. WDC +2.9%, STX +3.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • EVEIQ

    Evergreen Energy (EEE) announces preliminary estimates of coal resources in its Penrhyn Deposit...

    Evergreen Energy (EEE) announces preliminary estimates of coal resources in its Penrhyn Deposit are 350M tons, far better than the initial 200M it had expected. Shares +20% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • FST

    Macquarie and BofA/Merrill downgrade Forest Oil (NYSE:FST) after the company lowers production...

    Macquarie and BofA/Merrill downgrade Forest Oil (NYSE:FST) after the company lowers production guidance, partially due to the ongoing consolidation of its Lone Pine operations. Shares -7.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • APAC

    Premarket gainers: APAC +56%. MCZ +14%. OCZ +9%. RENN +8%. PMI +7%. TGT +6%. REDF +5%. DANG +5%....

    Premarket gainers: APAC +56%. MCZ +14%. OCZ +9%. RENN +8%. PMI +7%. TGT +6%. REDF +5%. DANG +5%. KSS +5%. MOBI +5%. STX +4%. BPAX +4%. GPL +4%. LTD +4%. ASML +4%. YOKU +3%. M +3%. STD +3%. SODA +3%. SINA +3%. NOK +3%. RDN +3%.
    Losers: AFFX -16%. LL -16%. FST -7%. YMI -6%. JCP -4%. AIB -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • PFE

    Pfizer (PFE +1.1%) plans to explore strategic alternatives for its animal health and nutrition...

    Pfizer (PFE +1.1%) plans to explore strategic alternatives for its animal health and nutrition units, including possible sales. (PR) (sector background)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • V

    Goldman reiterates its bullish view on Visa (NYSE:V), and expects "the combination of a strong...

    Goldman reiterates its bullish view on Visa (NYSE:V), and expects "the combination of a strong growth profile and a further valuation reset to more closely reflect its long-term growth of 17%... will drive outsized stock returns." Yesterday Visa affirmed its FY11 outlook. Shares -0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • LL

    Lumber Liquidators (NYSE:LL) is -17% premarket after cutting its FY forecast and projecting...

    Lumber Liquidators (NYSE:LL) is -17% premarket after cutting its FY forecast and projecting lower Q2 profits on weaker-than-expected sales. "We had not anticipated the rapid softening in customer demand given the improved sales trends at the end of the first quarter," says CEO Jeff Griffiths.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • M

    Macy's (NYSE:M) up 2.5% after announcing same-store sales rose 6.7% Y/Y. The Gap (NYSE:GPS) up...

    Macy's (NYSE:M) up 2.5% after announcing same-store sales rose 6.7% Y/Y. The Gap (NYSE:GPS) up 2.3% after reporting June same-store sales rose 1% Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • TGT

    Target (NYSE:TGT) is up 4.8% premarket after reporting June same-store sales rose 4.5% Y/Y,...

    Target (NYSE:TGT) is up 4.8% premarket after reporting June same-store sales rose 4.5% Y/Y, compared with 1.7% growth in the year-ago period. Total sales for June rose 5.7% Y/Y, raising year-to-date sales growth to 3.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) gets cut to Neutral from Conviction Buy at Goldman, which is still...

    Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) gets cut to Neutral from Conviction Buy at Goldman, which is still positive on the stock but sees little chance of meaningful EPS upside now that Starbucks has approached its $44 price target. SBUX -1.5% to $39.80.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • YUM

    Goldman downgrades Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) to Sell from Neutral, pointing to uncertainty in China,...

    Goldman downgrades Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) to Sell from Neutral, pointing to uncertainty in China, which accounts for 40% of the firm's profit, and Taco Bell weakness. Shares -1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM
  • ASML

    ASML (NASDAQ:ASML) +2.3% after getting raised to Buy from Neutral at UBS.

    ASML (NASDAQ:ASML) +2.3% after getting raised to Buy from Neutral at UBS.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM
